string.text:
%c[ui_gray_1]PSO (for Pritsel Snaipersky Optichesky, "Optical Sniper Sight") is a series of Soviet-made optical scopes produced by Novosibirsk Instrument-Making Plant (NPZ Optics State Plant). In common use since 1964 when it was introduced as a standard issue telescopic sight for SVD sniper rifle. The scope has been later adapted to assault rifles such as AK-74 or AN-94. Recognized for its durability, versatility and very well-designed reticle pattern featuring convenient range-finder scale. This particular scope has 4.0x magnification rate, making it usable mainly for combat at long ranges. It is attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount, which is standard in Warsaw Pact countries.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] Dovetail mount
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticle pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]PSO-1

%c[ui_gray_1]The USP-1 sight (index 1P29) has an optical arrangement with a prism-erecting system. Sighting angles are set mechanically by turning the sight body relative to the weapon mounting bracket. Requires no batteries as it is tritium illuminated. The ranging scale at the edge of the sight's field of view provides a means to find visually the range of up to 1200 m of a target 1.5 m high.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] Dovetail mount
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticle pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]PSU-1

%c[ui_gray_1]The Barska Electro Sight Multi Reticle Red Dot Sight AC10632 was developed in order to be the best product for anybody looking for a high quality sights. Can be mounted on NATO weapons and on AK-12.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] Picatinny/weaver rail
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]none (collimator)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good

%c[ui_gray_1]ACOG stands for Advanced Combat Optical Gunsights and refers to a family of firearm scopes produced by the Trijicon company. Scopes of this type are usually of high quality and have an internal tritium-based reticle illumination. This particular type has a USMC-style reticle and features adjustable magnification.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] Picatinny/weaver rail
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticle pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]USMC

%c[ui_gray_1]Holographic sight for NATO assault rifles and sub-machine guns.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] Picatinny/weaver rail
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]none (collimator)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good

%c[ui_gray_1]Optical sight for the Israeli IMI Galil rifle.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] automatic rifle Galil AR
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticle pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]SUSAT

%c[ui_gray_1]The Kobra sight is an open collimator combat optic using a laser generated HUD to superimpose a reticle pattern onto a filtered lens. It is designed for engaging fast moving targets and targets appearing for a short period of time in close quarters and urban combat in various light conditions. It provides clear targeting from 104 lx to 10-2 lx (daylight, twilight and moonlight), one or two eye targeting. Effective when shooting from moving vehicles.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] Dovetail mount
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1] none (collimator)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good

%c[ui_gray_1]Optical sight for the OTs-14 weapon series.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] OTs-14 weapon series
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticle pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]4x34

%c[ui_gray_1]The PSO-1M2-O1 features an extremely effective and useful height-based rangefinder for dual use, with graduated scales for both standing and prone figure estimation. The 400 meter Simonov height based gradient (choke style) rangefinder has a chevron for use with the 9x39 caliber rifles.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] all Warsaw Pact rifles
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticle pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]PSO-1-1

%c[ui_gray_1]Standard-issue telescopic sight of the Red Army in World War II and years after it, designed to fit infantry and precision rifles such as Mosin-Nagant or SVT-40. It features a fixed 3.5x zoom making it a good choice for long-distance combat. Like all Soviet designs, it is durable and effective, remaining in production and use to this day.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] historic Russian rifles
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]3.5x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]average
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticle pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]PU

%c[ui_gray_1]ZF-4 is one of the first telescopic sights ever created. Designed and manufactured in Germany during World War II, it was intended to provide regular infantry with the ability to fight at long distances. In the end, due to insufficient numbers produced, it has been primarily used by German snipers and elite combat squads. The scope is still in use since weapons it has been designed for are commonly available, hence it remains a relatively popular model in the Zone as well.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] historic German rifles
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]2.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticle pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]ZF-41

High performance red dot sight that provides an unlimited field of view, while eliminating obstruction and tunnel vision common to tube style scopes. The Railway series has a standard rail base pre-installed to allow the sight to be attached to most Weaver or Picatinny rail mounts or receivers.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] Picatinny/weaver rail
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]none (collimator)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
Cheap 2x magnification red dot sight for NATO assault rifles, sub-machine guns and on AK-12.

%c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for .45 ACP pistols and sub-machine guns.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] .45 caliber weapons
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]very high (pistol)

%c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for the FN-P90 PDW and FN Five-seveN pistol.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.7 mm caliber weapons
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]high

%c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for the PB pistol.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 9 mm caliber weapons
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]very good

%c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for the 9A-91 carbine and VSK-94.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 9x39 caliber weapons
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]very high

%c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for 9mm pistols and sub-machine guns. An effective sound suppressor for caliber 9x18 weapons. It is very archaic and yet quite effective. Its body contains a tightly-packed roll of fine brass mesh. The front of the unit comprises a set of rubber wipes with caliber-sized holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used for close-combat engagements against armored enemies and for assassinations.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 9 mm caliber weapons
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]very high

%c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for the OTs-33 "Pernach" pistol.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 9 mm caliber weapons
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]medium

%c[ui_gray_1]The tactical automatic silencer (ATG) is designed to reduce the sound and fierceness of the shot when firing from 5.45 mm Kalashnikov assault rifles AK74, AKS74, AK74M, AK105; 5.56 mm Kalashnikov assault rifles AK101 and AK102, as well as 7.62 mm Kalashnikov assault rifles AK103 and AK104.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.45, 5.56, 7.62 Cal.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]medium

%c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for the Glock, FN-FNP, Walther etc.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 9 mm, .45 caliber weapons
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]high

%c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for the SVD sniper rifle.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 7.62 caliber weapons
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]medium

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] .45, 5.56, 7.62 caliber weapons
 %c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for the standard NATO 5.56x45mm caliber rifles.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]high

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 7.62 caliber weapons
 %c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for noiseless and flameless firing from Kalashnikov 7.62mm.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]medium

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.45 caliber weapons
 %c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for AKS-74U rifle.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]medium

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 7.62 mm caliber weapons
 %c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for the SR-25
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]high

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.45 caliber weapons
 %c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for AK rifle series and RPK-74 machine guns.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]medium

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 9x39 caliber weapons
 %c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for the SR-3M rifle.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]very high

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.56x45 caliber weapons
 %c[ui_gray_1]Advanced rifle suppressor of US design and manufacture, which has apparently 'disappeared' from one of the US Army supply containers. It consists of hi-grade steel body filled with four extension chambers, followed by a series of Z-type titanium baffles. The unit almost completely reduces muzzle flash and considerably suppresses sound emitted when firing. It also requires minimum maintenance. Suppressors of this and similar types are commonly used on all small-bore Western-made rifles and remain in active service in Western armed forces.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]medium

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] SVU rifles
 %c[ui_gray_1]This specially designed three-chambered suppressor is not intended to completely silence the SVU rifle since the soldier would not be using subsonic ammunition. Its main purpose is to quiet and diffuse the noise enough to make detection by the enemy difficult. Its special feature is a very effective muzzle break placed on end of suppressor, capable of reducing recoil by about 40%. Above capabilities come at the cost of reduced muzzle velocity and thus significantly lower the weapon's damage output.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]low
 %c[ui_gray_1]SPECIAL:
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] enhanced recoil reduction

Detachable optical scope made specifically for NATO rifles. ACOG stands for Advanced Combat Optical Gunsights and refers to a family of firearm scopes produced by the Trijicon company. Scopes of this type are usually of high quality and have an internal tritium-based reticle illumination. This particular type has a modern 'trijicon' reticle pattern and fixed magnification of 2.0x.
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] Picatinny/weaver rail
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]2.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticle pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]trijicon
